title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
hi, i have 820-00281-a dead, water damage at u3200 area (u3200 replaced) and at area u3100(replaced too) i was also replace u7000 and u6903..now its give me 5v loop at charger i was look for short on ppbus_3gh(0.9v) but cant find any....any idea?
thanks!

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
Do you get 3V3_G3H?
Also check SMC_RESET_L and BUF_SMC_RESET_L.

Inspect the other two USB-C ports; all four CD3215 chips must talk with SMC.
Check if all LDO voltages come out from these chips.
Also compare diode mode readings on all of their power rails.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
3V3_G3H - 3.4V
SMC_RESET_L- 3.4V
BUF_SMC_RESET_L. -3.3V

At all 4 its the same (5v - 5s loop)
alll the LDO voltage are O.K except PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC from UB400 AND ub300.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: im also dont get PP5V_S4 - 0V

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
You must get all LDO voltages.
Be aware, you must connect the charger on the corresponding port.

Compare diode mode readings on LDO lines, between the 4 CD3215 chips.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
U3200
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO - 3.4v dido mode----505
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA - 1.8v ---480
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD - 1.8v---480
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC - 1.0v---505

U3100
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO -3.3v ---505
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA -1.8v----1270
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC -0v----1
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD -1.8v---480

UB300
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO - 3.4v----506
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA -1.8V----1303
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD -1.8V----480
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC-1.0V---1750

UB400
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO -3.4V----503
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA -0V----514
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD -1.8V----480
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC - 0V----730

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: Looks to have problems with U3100 and UB400...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: I will replace them, and post result..thanks!

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: some update..i was replaced U3100 AND UB400, at the u3100/3200 still 5v loop, at the UB400/300 one still 5v loop and one 5v stable....

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
You still have problems on USB-C areas.
A common problem (after these areas), will cause the same behaviour on all ports.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: so.. still one of the CD3215 is make the problem ?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: Or other thing connected to CD3215 chips, like U2800/90...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: there is a way to check what can cause the problems?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
If you don't get all LDO outputs, should be CD3215 issue.
Did you solder new chips, or refurbished?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: 2 new but i dont know if they good i was order now more

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: update, i was just got 4 new ones...i was replaced all 4, at the u3100/3200 still 5v stable, at the UB400/300 still 5v loop...so its from other place, i think..what can i check next?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
You cannot have different behaviour from an issue on a common point.
USB-C areas have more chips, not only CD3215.
Check for corrosion on the corresponding ROMs and Thunderbolt chips.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
there was corrosion near u4200 and some V are missing like P3V3_S4_SOC_PMU, i was put some flux and move it..but the same, reball/ replace?
this cup are missing c4916 pp3v0_messa, importent for this problem?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: C4916 is not important to get PPBUS_G3H; PP3V0_MESA is not in S5 state.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: what next please?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
Inspect entire USB-C areas for corrosion, not only CD3215 chips.
Pay atention to U2800/90, UB000/90 and surrounding resistors.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: following because im having this issue with the missing BMC LDO...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
still the same...
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC 0v at U3100 and PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC at UB400.
check U2800/90 all look good

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
Compare diode mode readings for all LDO rails between all CD3215 chips.
Better if you have working board for comparison.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: OK, just wanted to let you know i have resolved all of these with a missing BMC LDO by replacing the TBT ROM (U2890 on a 00840 board). In all of them, the BMC LDOs came back and i got 20v back.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
Upload working ROM somewhere please.
This will really help...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
yeah ill give it a shot.
i have a TL866II reader, but i dont have any fitting adapters for this. i think the chip is in 8pin uson package. Do you know of a good adapter? i could of course solder wires but if theres anything avalable....

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: crap, so i got a solderboard (a levelshifter board, but can use it in 3v3 mode as well) that the chip fits onto, but customer needed his machine back early so had to close it up. I do have another repaired board in, i could take the dump off of that?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
Only a problem on USB-C areas can generate different behaviour, depending of wich port is connected to charger.
Can be one of the chips above mentioned, or resistors, traces, even protection diodes from data lines.

The dump from exact board model should probably work...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
hey 2informaticos, i've got the rom soldered on to this board: A4069 from this link: [URL]http://www.cmizapper.com/buy/medusa-accessories.html[/URL]
i have it hooked up to my reader (A TL866 II), but the software doesn't have the right Device ID to read from the chip. all connections are good to the reader (have checked with multimeter) 
I have selected W25Q80DV @ WSON8  as device-id, since i think its the closest match, but it won't work (gives me a message saying incorrect package).
I think i need a W25Q80DV @ USON8 (since it's a USON package) but my software doesnt have this particular device-id.
software i'm using is XGPro 8.51, maybe you have an idea of other software to read it?

I'm probably going to give it up if i cant figure it out over the next days since the machine has to go back.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
A4069 has 2 connection ways; use 3V3 side for this chip.
Check chip to DIL8 adapter pin correspondence.

I ordered A4069/70 adapters, but didn't get them yet to test...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
I think it specifically says to connect it to the port that’s labelled as the 1v8 side (normally used to connect a 1v8 ROM, in that case,the other 3v3-port then connects to the medusa).

The port labelled 1v8 bypasses the levelshifter i.e: the only thing between port and soldered chip is traces.

by the way, there’s a dot on the board to help with orientation. It is correctly oriented on my board now.
my thought was now that my TL866 is not reading the chip because of the wrong deviceID in the software.
do you know if W25Q80DV @ WSON8 matches this chip?

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
TL866 doesn't support 1V8 chips directly.
So you need to use the level shifter.

Manually set different codes and see what you can read...

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
yeah this is a 3.3 volts ic though.

i have tried all the possible device IDs this thing has, but no dice.. gonna give up, sorry.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: so you think that my problem is TBT ROM (U2890), there was a tine liquid near to him..

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
Could be bad chip, easy to discard trying to read one from other board.
Can be just corrupted dump, or some broken trace of it.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message:
well the chip's not bad; it's back on its board now and the machine is fully working again.
i've beeped out the sides of the chip (when it was soldered on the solderboard) to the DIL-legs: everything was correctly connected.
you said you've got a solderboard on the way, right? Maybe try it out when you get it.

title: 820-00281-a 5v loop
message: so you think that my problem is TBT ROM (U2890), there was a tine liquid near to him..

I only order donorboards now that i take them off of and reball them/ also ordered from louis, but that shit is expensive.
